cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 275 miles SW of Port-au-Prince, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northward, forecast to accelerate and arc NNW across the Bahamas mid-week, then parallel or brush the Florida/Georgia coastline late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Possible first U.S. landfall along Florida’s east coast (around Cape Canaveral) late Thu–early Fri, after earlier landfall in Haiti and eastern Cuba tonight–Tue.

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted yet for the U.S. coast; interests in Florida peninsula/Keys advised to monitor.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to Jamaica, Haiti, eastern Cuba and the southeastern/central Bahamas.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas likely to experience hazardous conditions late Thu–Sat.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm–force winds (gale to 45 kt) possible late Thu–Fri with a 16 % cumulative chance of ≥34 kt; small (5 %) chance of ≥50 kt.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center passes just offshore, onshore winds could push 3–5 ft of surge into the Georgia barrier-island inlets and marsh system.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands associated with Matthew could dump 4–6 inches (locally 8 inches) across coastal Georgia Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and minor coastal flooding could disrupt vessel movements and port operations.
